comment: He loves what he does and it shows. 4 tests, 2 homeworks weekly, 2 ai papers. Caring and very knowledgeable.

Take this class!! Professor Blalock made it enjoyable. He is nice and cares about his students. I actually learned a lot of new things. The lectures are lengthy, but attending them helps to pass the class. PowerPoint slides are posted on D2L, and study guides are as well.  There were 4 exams, 2 papers, and extra credit at the end of the semester.

One of my favorite professors ever, very welcoming, very funny, very engaging, and more. If you want to learn a lot about psychology and have fun while doing it, take his PSYC 1101 class and I doubt you will regret it.

Professor Blalock is super nice and really strives for his students success. All powerpoints are posted on d2l as well as study guides (that the tests are made from.) Only thing I had a hard time with was how lengthy the lectures/ slides were.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Blalock really sets you up for success tho with all powerpoints online as well as study guides!! Just be aware that he has very long lectures with very wordy slides.

There are two assignments, due every Sunday and they are fairly easy. Class isn't mandatory but listening to the lectures help on the exams. 4 Exams, 2 Papers, and Extra Credit at the end of the semester. Professor Blalock is a good teacher but be prepared to listen to lengthy lectures mainly read directly from a PowerPoint.

Prof. Blalock loves what he does and cares about student success. Although his lectures can be unbearably long sometimes, he will sit up there and just talk over the PPT for about an hour not much engagement. His course has 4 exams(Lowest dropped),two HW tasks a week(Not hard), and 2 ChatGPT papers. He is easy to work with and recommend him!

A very funny, caring, and overall great professor. Provides several opportunities to replace or drop low scores on assignments, and gives good, detail heavy lectures, and engages with the class often.

He lectures a lot but attendance isn't mandatory and the assignments are very easy! You're given the same two assignments weekly which are simple then just a test every 3 or so weeks. Tests aren't terrible, just make sure you STUDY IN ADVANCE!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: TAKE HIM IF YOU'RE A PSYCH MAJOR! My fav prof, kind, funny, engaging, supportive, lenient grading. 4 easy test (lowest dropped), weekly assignments, 2 AI papers. Tests are in person, scantron. Grades quickly, all scores get a curve. Textbook needed. All you need for tests are the study guides. I wish I could take him every semester!
Lectures are interesting if you like psychology. Tests were pretty difficult though since the study guide was basically a document with the PowerPoint slides needed for the test. summer semester'24

Professor Blalock did an incredible job with his teaching. His powerpoints were pretty long, though. He was great with answering all questions as well. He is a soft speaker, so if you have a hard time hearing I would suggest you move closer to the front of the class.

This class is 4 exams (one dropped), 2 papers, weekly homework, and a PREX study. He makes explicit study guides for the exams, if you study them well you'll do well. His lectures and his slides are really helpful and informative and he posts the slides online. The papers, homework, and prex are all easy to get done.

Know that this professor genuinely cares about his students and is always there to help. However,  in terms of organization and clarity, I felt like I was often guessing what he was looking for. While the material can sometimes be challenging to follow. Definitely take advantage of his office hours. That is the only reason I was able to get an A.
Probably one of the best professors at KSU

This professor has very little grades; however, he truly cares about his students and is very knowledgeable in Psychology! If you study and pay attention in class you'll do fine. You have some little assignments here and there, but you have 4 exams and he drops the lowest one! I do recommend, just be prepared to study, study, study!

Prof Blalock is a super nice guy, with good clear lecture slides, that are posted online. His study guides clearly list what you need to know. There are 4 exams (but only 3 count), 2 chatgpt essays (which are easy), and weekly homework. If you take notes, study the study guide and do the essays and homework this class is easy.

I genuinely love this professor. His lectures were so entertaining. I often took notes from the PPTs in my own time and just attended class to listen to him. He gave lots of awesome demonstrations that made sense of the content being taught. His 2 essays use ChatGPT (very easy), and I scored A+'s on all the exams using his study guides.

Dr. Blalock was a kind professor, he gave good feedback on the 3 papers he gave. However the PowerPoint was a lot of information, he doesn't take attendance but the class felt super long. Tests were hard but as long as you do your homework and papers you will do fine.

He is a sweetheart like actually. He baked us homemade cookies and i feel bad to say i hated his class. It was very test heavy, but honestly the weekly quizzes saved my grade and helped me get a 98. all of the tests were application based questions so you had to know how to apply the term which is hard when there is so many

He is a good professor, the class just wasn't for me. He does not take attendance and all material is available online. There are weekly online quizzes on the textbook. He gives out study guides before each test that cover the lecture slides and 3-4 textbook chapters. There's 3 essays that use ChatGBT. The final is just the last of 4 regular test.

Professor Blalock is genuinely one of the best professors I've ever had, all his lectures are engaging and it makes me wish I went to more of his lectures. Honestly just do your work on time and follow the guidelines for his paper and you will be perfectly fine in his class.

Hands down the sweetest professor I had. He was very lenient and understood conflicts as long as you communicated with him. His class teaching style was not for me -  he had a low voice that couldn't project to the back of the classroom. But, his slideshows and lecture notes were always online. Study guides are online as well. Excellent professor.

Overall, the class was not difficult if you went in there and paid attention. He did read a lot off of PowerPoint so his teaching style may not be for everybody. 4 major tests, 3 ChatGPT papers, 26 achieve assignments(easy), and Prex assignment that counts 40 points. He grades using points not percentages. Do the study guide, & you'll pass the test

he is a kind teacher. I personally didn't like his teaching style, he reads off the PowerPoint and sometimes skipping slides. he has a low mumble voice so if u have a hard time hearing probably don't take him. 4 tests one of which gets dropped, 3 AI papers, and two weekly ACHIEVE hw. I wouldn't take him again cuz I was mostly teaching myself. :(

He is very sweet. We had three papers. He makes us use ChatGBT to write them; they are easy. Four tests, lowest gets dropped. It is a lot of content, so they are a little hard. Weekly online homework through ACHIEVE. Lowest four are dropped. Does fun activities in class. He is a nice guy, I would reccomend him. He gives study guides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: he just does powerpoints during class however he puts everything on d2L. We have two assignments every week that usually took me like 10 minutes for both. You have three papers the whole semester. VERY EASY he tells you to us ChatGTP. hes NOT  a tough grader. he gives you a study guide which is helpful but you HAVE TO study.

He is a really cool guy, and the class wasn't hard at all. There is weekly homework, but it isn't long. There are 3 papers, but they are easy because you don't really write them. 4 tests total, but you can drop one if you like your grade on the other 3. I rarely go to class, and I still have an A.

I had Mr Blalock my first semester of college and absolutely loved him. Attendance isn't mandatory but I never missed a class. His lectures are so entertaining and he often tells funny stories that connects to what we learn. He's very funny and nonchalant but gets through the material quickly so It might be smart to try and get ahead of him.

TAKE HIM!!! He is legit my fav professor I've had at KSU. He hilarious and actually cares about you. He's more concerned about your questions than just getting through the lecture. He has study guides made for the tests and brings his own scantrons, no need to purchase your own.

If you want an easy grade or an A then this is the guy. Homework helps a lot for test studying but all answers are found online if your lazy. Test are personally harder but he always curve to get an average of 75. got Bs on every test and had over a 100 in the class. 4 papers but opinionated easy grade. Take if you can!!!

This class is one that the homework is very easy and prepares you for the test. There is so much homework that allows you to get a 100 on that if you do poor on the test it still balances out at an A. So Take this CLASS!!
The assignments for the class were very easy however the test were difficult because it was a lot of information so remember to study.

TAKE HIM! Best professor ever. Attendance is mandatory, but he makes it so worth it. Very passionate with tons of experience that he shares. He is very caring and hilarious. 2 easy assignments each week, tests are a little harder, but do the study guides and you will get an A no problem. Cannot recommend him enough!
I loved Professor Blalock. The best part of his class was the reflection papers. He can get off track sometimes but overall, an amazing teacher.

Prof. Blalock is such an amazing professor, he really cares about what he is teaching and he's relates his life experience to what you learn. 2 online activities/quizzes each week that are easy. 4 tests in class which aren't difficult if you study the terms and reflection/ feedback papers after each test. Highly recommend taking him for this class!

Overall, Dr. B is a really funny guy and makes his lectures interesting. His tests are super overwhelming with over 60 questions and the material is super long. We have to write a two page reflection after every test which is super annoying. His class is fun but all the work for the tests really makes me wish I took a different professor.

He is one of the most funny and caring professors here at KSU, very engaging and entertaining. Lots of notetaking, and you'll have quizzes on each chapter weekly, but said quizzes are relatively easy if you pay attention and take good notes, same with the tests. Attendance is mandatory, but I enjoyed attending his class each day
He is a very nice, chill professor. He does a good job of making this class stress-free!

The easiest class I have ever taken in college, super understanding, gives good feedback on assignments, if struggling he will help you. Super funny and likes when you respond to the questions when asked. If he taught every class here, I would take it with him.

His class is easy you have 10 quizzes & they r only on definitions he gives them every week which annoying, but lets u grade ur own...so do whatever u want with that info lol. reflection papers are easy & attendance matters for in class assignments. Gives you study points for tests and quizzes so you know what to focus on. Take him if u can
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor and easy class! He does 10-question quizzes that are all matching and multiple choice exams. He is very understanding and will let you make up almost any quiz or exam you miss. Quiet at times so don't sit in the back, but overall it was a great class!
He is a really great professor and makes the class engaging. The tests and quizzes are really easy to follow and you will get an A as long as you pay somewhat attention and look at textbook.
Very nice and tries to help students with late work and making up assignments
